Class Entity

java.lang.Object
com.goblinskeep.entity.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Goblin, Player
public abstract class Entity extends Object
Represents a general game entity, serving as the base class for player and enemy characters. This class defines movement properties, collision areas, and sprite animations.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity(GamePanel gp, int WorldX, int WorldY)
      Constructor to initialize the entity at a specific position in the world.
      Parameters:
      gp - The game panel instance.
      WorldX - The x-coordinate of the entity in the game world.
      WorldY - The y-coordinate of the entity in the game world.

  • Method Details

    • canMove

      protected boolean canMove()
      Checks if the entity can move based on collision status.
      Returns:
      boolean if the entity can move

    • getEffectiveDirection

      protected Direction getEffectiveDirection()
      Sets the direction of the entity based on user input. This method is called to update the entity's movement direction.
      Returns:
      Direction The new direction for the entity to move in.

    • canUpdateSprite

      protected boolean canUpdateSprite()
      Determines if the sprite animation can be updated. Subclasses can override this to add custom conditions.
      Returns:
      True if the sprite animation can be updated, false otherwise.

    • updateAnimation

      protected void updateAnimation()
      Updates the sprite animation for the entity. Subclasses can override `canUpdateSprite` to add additional conditions.

    • getSpriteForDirection

      protected BufferedImage getSpriteForDirection()
      Returns the sprite image for the player's current direction.
      Returns:
      The sprite image for the current direction.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the entity on the screen based on its current direction and position.
      Parameters:
      g2 - The graphics context used for rendering.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Gets the entity's current x-coordinate.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of the entity in the game world.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Gets the entity's current y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of the entity in the game world.

    • getSpeed

      public int getSpeed()
      Gets the movement speed of the entity.
      Returns:
      The speed value.

    • setX

      public void setX(int NewX)
      Sets a new x-coordinate for the entity.
      Parameters:
      NewX - The new x-coordinate in the game world.

    • setY

      public void setY(int NewY)
      Sets a new y-coordinate for the entity.
      Parameters:
      NewY - The new x-coordinate in the game world.

    • moveEntityTowardDirection

      public void moveEntityTowardDirection()
      Moves the entity in the direction it is currently facing. The movement is based on the entity's speed and the direction

    • loadImage

      public static BufferedImage loadImage(String path)
      Loads an image from the given resource path. This method attempts to read an image file located in the classpath using
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the image resource, starting from the root of the classpath (e.g. "/goblin/orc_up_1.png")
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the loaded image
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the image cannot be found or read
